snippet: The Stamford state’s attorney said there was not sufficient evidence to charge anyone in connection with a fire that killed three girls and their grandparents.
abstract: Connecticut prosecutors says no criminal charges will be filed in connection with Christmas morning fire in Stamford that killed Madonna Badger's three young daughters and her parents; says investigation did not find sufficient evidence for any criminal charges and that safety of public would not be enhanced by prosecution.
lead_paragraph: The Stamford state’s attorney said there was not sufficient evidence to charge anyone in connection with a fire that killed three girls and their grandparents.

headline.seo: Prosecutor Won’t File Criminal Charges in Stamford Christmas Fire
headline.main: No Charges to Be Filed in Deadly Christmas Fire, Connecticut Prosecutor Says
headline.print_headline: No Charges to Be Filed in Deadly Christmas Fire, Connecticut Prosecutor Says
